title: Problem 2040_C
statement: Consider a permutation^{\text{∗}} p_1, p_2, ..., p_n of integers from 1 to n. We can introduce the following sum for it^{\text{†}}:S(p) = ∑_{1 ≤ l ≤ r ≤ n} \min(p_l, p_{l + 1}, ..., p_r)Let us consider all permutations of length n with the maximum possible value of S(p). Output the k-th of them in lexicographical^{\text{‡}}order, or report that there are less than k of them.^{\text{∗}}A permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order. For exam
